data.question: Which of the following are reasons to configure VLANs on a switch as opposed to using switches without VLANs?
data.correct_answer: Increased security AND Increased number of broadcast domains
data.incorrect_answers__001: Redundant paths between two hosts AND Allowing broadcast traffic between subnets
data.incorrect_answers__002: Increased number of broadcast domains AND Increased number of collision domains
data.incorrect_answers__003: Increased number of collision domains AND Increased number of broadcast domains
data.explanation: Create VLANs to increase the number of broadcast domains and to implement security. Each VLAN is in its own broadcast domain. Broadcast traffic within the VLAN goes only to the members of the VLAN. Members of one VLAN can only communicate with members in the same VLAN through the switch. A router or a Layer 3 switch is required to enable inter-VLAN communication.Using switches increases the number of collision domains, with each switch port being its own collision domain. Using VLANs does not offer this additional advantage. Spanning tree lets you have loop-free, redundant paths through a switched network. Broadcast traffic does not travel between routers.
incorrect_answers: Redundant paths between two hosts AND Allowing broadcast traffic between subnets
Increased number of broadcast domains AND Increased number of collision domains
Increased number of collision domains AND Increased number of broadcast domains
data.answer1: Increased security AND Increased number of broadcast domains
data.answer2: Redundant paths between two hosts AND Allowing broadcast traffic between subnets
data.answer3: Increased number of broadcast domains AND Increased number of collision domains
data.answer4: Increased number of collision domains AND Increased number of broadcast domains

data.question: Which of the following statements describe how VLANs affect broadcast traffic within an internetwork?
data.correct_answer: Devices on the same VLAN have the same subnet address AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted only within a VLAN.
data.incorrect_answers__001: Broadcast traffic is transmitted only within a VLAN AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted to all devices on all VLANs.
data.incorrect_answers__002: Broadcast traffic is only transmitted on VLAN1 AND Devices on separate VLANs share the same subnet address
data.incorrect_answers__003: Devices on separate VLANs share the same subnet address AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted to all devices on all VLANs
data.explanation:
VLANs allow computers to be grouped into a common broadcast domain regardless of their physical location on the network. Broadcast traffic is seen only by computers belonging to the same VLAN. Devices sharing a VLAN ID must also share the same subnet address so that traffic can be routed between VLANs.
Broadcast traffic is only transmitted to devices belonging to the same VLAN as the device that sent the broadcast. Broadcast traffic is not forwarded to the other VLANs.
incorrect_answers: Broadcast traffic is transmitted only within a VLAN AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted to all devices on all VLANs.
Broadcast traffic is only transmitted on VLAN1 AND Devices on separate VLANs share the same subnet address
Devices on separate VLANs share the same subnet address AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted to all devices on all VLANs
data.answer1: Devices on the same VLAN have the same subnet address AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted only within a VLAN.
data.answer2: Broadcast traffic is transmitted only within a VLAN AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted to all devices on all VLANs.
data.answer3: Broadcast traffic is only transmitted on VLAN1 AND Devices on separate VLANs share the same subnet address
data.answer4: Devices on separate VLANs share the same subnet address AND Broadcast traffic is transmitted to all devices on all VLANs

data.question:
Switch B is a Catalyst 2924 switch you're configuring to support VLAN trunking. Switch B is both ISL and 802.1Q capable. Switch A is encapsulating 802.1Q. You want Switch B's port to be in trunk mode regardless of the mode configured on Switch A.
Which commands should you use to configure the trunk port on Switch B?
data.correct_answer: switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q AND switchport mode trunk
data.incorrect_answers__001: switchport trunk encapsulation isl AND switchport mode trunk
data.incorrect_answers__002: switchport trunk encapsulation 802.1q AND switchport mode auto
data.incorrect_answers__003: switchport mode trunk AND switchport mode auto
data.explanation: First encapsulate the trunking protocol on Switch B with the command, switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q. Then, force the port into trunk with the command, switchport mode trunk
incorrect_answers: switchport trunk encapsulation isl AND switchport mode trunk
switchport trunk encapsulation 802.1q AND switchport mode auto
switchport mode trunk AND switchport mode auto
data.answer1: switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q AND switchport mode trunk
data.answer2: switchport trunk encapsulation isl AND switchport mode trunk
data.answer3: switchport trunk encapsulation 802.1q AND switchport mode auto
data.answer4: switchport mode trunk AND switchport mode auto

data.question: You are implementing a static VLAN trunking configuration on a Catalyst 3550 switch. You would like to keep the switch from tagging packets from VLAN 3 as they leave FastEthernet 0/1. Which command(s) would you use?
data.correct_answer:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode trunk
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk native vlan 3
data.incorrect_answers__001:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode access
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk native vlan 3
data.incorrect_answers__003:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode trunk
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
data.explanation:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode trunk
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk encapsulation dot1qUse the switchport trunk native vlan interface configuration command to set the native VLAN for sending and receiving untagged traffic when the interface is in 802.1Q trunking mode. Use the switchport mode trunk command on the interface. The port will not use Dynamic Trunking Protocol (DTP) on the interface.
The switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q command configures the interface to use the 802.1Q trunking protocol.
The switchport mode access command configures the interface to function as an access port unconditionally and operate as a non-trunking, single VLAN interface that sends and receives non-encapsulated (non-tagged) frames.
incorrect_answers:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode access
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk native vlan 3

Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode trunk

Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode trunk
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q
data.answer1:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode trunk
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk native vlan 3
data.answer2:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode access
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk native vlan 3
data.answer4:
Switch(config)#int fa 0/1
Switch(config-if)#switchport mode trunk
Switch(config-if)#switchport trunk encapsulation dot1q

data.question: You've just enabled port security on an interface of a Catalyst 2950 switch. You want to generate an SNMP trap whenever a violation occurs. Which feature should you enable?
data.explanation:
The feature restrict configures two actions whenever a violation occurs:
  1. The interface will not forward any frames from source addresses not assigned to the port.
  2. The switch generates a console message and sends an SNMP trap to a designated network management station whenever a violation occurs.
When the feature protect is enabled, the interface will not forward any frames from source addresses not assigned to the port. The shutdown feature shuts down the port when a violation occurs requiring it to be re-enabled by an administrator. There is no secure feature in the switchport port-security violation command.
incorrect_answers: protect
shutdown
secure

data.question:
You are configuring a new 2960 switch. You issue the following commands:
switch(config)#interface fast 0/15
switch(config-if)#switchport mode access
switch(config-if)#switchport port-security
switch(config-if)#switchport port-security maximum 1
switch(config-if)#switchport port-security mac-address sticky
switch(config-if)#switchport port-security violation protect
You connect a hub with two workstations to port Fa0/15. You power on first Device1 and then Device2.
What will be the result?
data.correct_answer: Frames from Device1 will be allowed; frames from Device2 will be dropped.
data.incorrect_answers__001: Port Fa0/15 will be disabled and no frames will be accepted or forwarded.
data.incorrect_answers__002: Frames from both Device1 and Device2 will be allowed.
data.incorrect_answers__003: Frames from Device2 will be allowed; frames from Device1 will be dropped.
data.explanation:
Based on this configuration, frames from Device1 will be allowed while frames from Device2 will be dropped. The switch allows a single MAC address to connect to each switch port. The switch is configured to learn the MAC address of the first device that connects, and grants access only to that device. When a second device is attached to the port, the protect parameter drops packets from unauthorized devices.
To allow both Device1 and Device2 to connect, set the maximum to 2. To disable a port when a violation occurs, configure shutdown as the violation method.
incorrect_answers: Port Fa0/15 will be disabled and no frames will be accepted or forwarded.
Frames from both Device1 and Device2 will be allowed.
Frames from Device2 will be allowed; frames from Device1 will be dropped.
data.answer1: Frames from Device1 will be allowed; frames from Device2 will be dropped.
data.answer2: Port Fa0/15 will be disabled and no frames will be accepted or forwarded.
data.answer3: Frames from both Device1 and Device2 will be allowed.
data.answer4: Frames from Device2 will be allowed; frames from Device1 will be dropped.

data.question: You have just enabled port security on a switch port. What are the default settings?
data.correct_answer: Maximum of 1 device, Dynamically-learned allowed addresses, Shutdown violation mode
data.incorrect_answers__001: Restrict violation mode, Statically-configured MAC addresses, Sticky learn MAC addresses
data.incorrect_answers__002: Maximum of 2 devices, Statically-configured MAC addresses, Protect violation mode
data.incorrect_answers__003: Shutdown violation mode, Dynamically-learned allowed addresses, Maximum of 2 devices
data.explanation:
Default port security settings are:
  • A maximum of 1 device per port
  • Violation mode set to shutdown
  • Addresses are dynamically learned, but not sticky
incorrect_answers: Restrict violation mode, Statically-configured MAC addresses, Sticky learn MAC addresses
Maximum of 2 devices, Statically-configured MAC addresses, Protect violation mode
Shutdown violation mode, Dynamically-learned allowed addresses, Maximum of 2 devices
data.answer1: Maximum of 1 device, Dynamically-learned allowed addresses, Shutdown violation mode
data.answer2: Restrict violation mode, Protect violation mode, Sticky learn MAC addresses
data.answer3: Maximum of 2 devices, Statically-configured MAC addresses, Protect violation mode
data.answer4: Shutdown violation mode, Dynamically-learned allowed addresses, Maximum of 2 devices

data.question:
You are in the process of configuring a new router. You have configured a hostname and ip domain name for the router. You continue with the following commands:
RouterA(config)#enable secret highway
RouterA(config)#username admin password television
RouterA(config)#crypto key generate rsa
RouterA(config)#aaa new-model
RouterA(config-line)#login
RouterA(config-line)#line vty 0 4
RouterA(config-line)#password garage
RouterA(config-line)#transport input ssh
RouterA(config)#line con 0
RouterA(config-line)#password airplane
What would you do to establish a remote console session with the router?
data.correct_answer: Run SSH AND Use admin for a username and television for the password
data.incorrect_answers__001: Run Telnet AND Use airplane for the password
data.incorrect_answers__002: Run a terminal emulation program AND Use highway for the password
data.incorrect_answers__003: Run a terminal emulation program AND Use garage for the password
data.explanation:
To create a remote console session, run SSH, then log on with the username of admin and password of television. The transport input ssh line configured the VTY line to accept only SSH for a connection. When connecting with SSH, a valid username and password combination must be entered.
Use Telnet and the password specified for the VTY line to make a remote console connection without using SSH. However, in this scenario, only SSH connections are allowed. Use the enable secret password to enter privileged EXEC mode. Use the con 0 password to establish a console session through a terminal emulation program.
incorrect_answers: Run Telnet AND Use airplane for the password
Run a terminal emulation program AND Use highway for the password
Run a terminal emulation program AND Use garage for the password
data.answer1: Run SSH AND Use admin for a username and television for the password
data.answer2: Run Telnet AND Use airplane for the password
data.answer3: Run a terminal emulation program AND Use highway for the password
data.answer4: Run a terminal emulation program AND Use garage for the password

data.question:
To secure remote console sessions, you have just configured your router to require SSH with the following command:
RouterA(config-line)#transport input ssh
When you go to connect, the system prompts you for a username and a password. You recall that you did not configure this information. Which command(s) would complete the SSH configuration?
data.explanation:
RouterA(config)#username admin
RouterA(config-line)#password canyon
RouterA(config-line)#loginTo specify a username and password for SSH, use the username command in global configuration mode. With this command, the password parameter is required.
incorrect_answers:
RouterA(config-line)#username admin password canyon
RouterA(config-line)#login

RouterA(config-line)#username admin
RouterA(config-line)#password canyon
RouterA(config-line)#loginRouterA(config-line)#username admin password canyon
RouterA(config-line)#login

RouterA(config)#username admin
RouterA(config-line)#password canyon
RouterA(config-line)#login

data.question: You are physically seated at a host connected to the console of the Seattle router as shown in the exhibit. You need to know what IP address has been configured on the E0 interface on the New York router. What are your options?
data.correct_answer:
• Telnet to New York. From privileged mode type show interface E0.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
data.incorrect_answers__001:
• Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show interface E0.
data.incorrect_answers__002:
• From privileged mode on Seattle, type show cdp neighbors detail.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
data.incorrect_answers__003:
• Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show interface E0.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
data.explanation:
You could either Telnet to Toronto and use the show cdp neighbors detail command, or you could Telnet to New York and in privileged mode type show interface E0.
Typing show cdp neighbors detail from the Seattle router will only show the interfaces of directly connected neighbors like Toronto. CDP cannot hop across devices to display information about neighbors on the other side.
Typing show interface E0 from the Toronto router will only display information about the E0 interface on the Toronto router.
incorrect_answers:
• Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show interface E0.

• From privileged mode on Seattle, type show cdp neighbors detail.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.

• Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show interface E0.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
data.answer1:
• Telnet to New York. From privileged mode type show interface E0.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
data.answer2:
• Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show interface E0.
data.answer3:
• From privileged mode on Seattle, type show cdp neighbors detail.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.
data.answer4:
• Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show interface E0.
  • Telnet to Toronto. From privileged mode type show cdp neighbors detail.

data.question: Which of the following protocols enables Cisco devices to discover non-Cisco devices?
data.explanation: Cisco devices support LLDP (link layer discovery protocol), which is a vendor-neutral device discovery protocol that allows network devices to advertise information about themselves.TLV descriptions are used by LLDP to communicate type, length, and value information to other devices on the network. CDP is Cisco's vendor-specific discovery protocol. DCBXP is an extension of LLDP that is used to announce, exchange, and negotiate node parameters between peer network devices.
incorrect_answers: TLV
CDP
DCBXP

data.question: LLDP is disabled on Cisco devices by default. Which of the following commands enables LLDP on a Cisco device?
data.explanation:
The LLDP protocol is enabled on a Cisco device with the feature lldp command, as shown:
switch(config)# lldp run
incorrect_answers: switch(config)# lldp on
switch(config)# enable lldp
switch(config)# lldp enable

data.question:
You have two Cisco 2960 switches with 12 FastEthernet ports and 2 GigabitEthernet ports on each switch.
You connect Fa0/1 on SwitchA to Fa0/1 on SwitchB with a crossover cable. A partial configuration for both switches is shown below.
hostname SwitchA
!
interface FastEthernet0/1
switchport mode dynamic auto
spanning-tree link-type point-to-point
!
--output omitted
!
interface GigabitEthernet0/1
switchport mode dynamic desirable
!
--output omitted
hostname SwitchB
!
interface FastEthernet0/1
switchport mode dynamic auto
!
--output omitted
!
interface GigabitEthernet0/1
switchport mode dynamic
esirable
spanning-tree link-type
point-to-point !
--output omitted
You notice that VLAN traffic for VLAN 2 is not being carried from SwitchA to SwitchB. What should you do?
data.correct_answer: For Fa0/1 on SwitchA, set the switchport mode to dynamic desirable.
data.incorrect_answers__001: For Fa0/1 on both switches, set the switchport mode to access.
data.incorrect_answers__002: Connect the switches using a straight-through cable.
data.incorrect_answers__003: Configure the encapsulation type on both switches to isl.
data.explanation:
By default, all ports on a Cisco switch will use the dynamic trunking protocol to detect when it is connected to a trunk port. However, when you set the switchport mode to dynamic auto on both sides of the link, the link will never become a trunk port. Set the switchport mode to dynamic desirable or trunk on at least one link to allow the trunk port to be recognized.
You can configure all ports as a trunk port. When connecting two switches, use a crossover cable, or a straight-through cable as well, if auto-MDIX is enabled. The encapsulation type on the switches already matches (both are using 802.1q); 2960 switches do not support ISL encapsulation. The switchport mode access is for ports with hosts (not switches) attached.
incorrect_answers: For Fa0/1 on both switches, set the switchport mode to access.
Connect the switches using a straight-through cable.
Configure the encapsulation type on both switches to isl.
data.answer1: For Fa0/1 on SwitchA, set the switchport mode to dynamic desirable.
data.answer2: For Fa0/1 on both switches, set the switchport mode to access.
data.answer3: Connect the switches using a straight-through cable.
data.answer4: Configure the encapsulation type on both switches to isl.

data.question:
You are troubleshooting Physical Layer issues with the Gi0/1 interface in a router. You need to view and analyze the number of collisions detected on the interface.
Which command should you use?
data.explanation:
show interfaces gi0/1 statusThe show interfaces gi0/1 command displays statistics about the Gi0/1 interface, including the number of collisions and late collisions.
The show interfaces gi0/1 status command displays summary information about the interface status. The output displays the port, name, status, VLAN assignment, duplex configuration, interface speed, and link type. The show interfaces gi0/1 description command displays the line and protocol status of the interface. The show controllers command is used to display configuration parameters for serial interfaces (not Ethernet interfaces), such as the type of serial cable and which end of the cable is connected to the device (DCE or DTE).
incorrect_answers: show interfaces gi0/1 description
show controllers gi0/1
show interfaces gi0/1 status
